definition: to teach by words and example (idiom)
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: The phenomenon is described as "acting as an example to others" and "equality of human rights".
sentences.chinese: 他們把這種現象解釋爲“言傳身教”和“人權平等。”

sentences.english: Teach them good manners and behavior through your actions as much as your words.
sentences.chinese: 孩子良好的習慣與行爲規範，要通過言傳身教來養成。

sentences.english: Confucius was knowledge and he always taught his students by his words and behaviors.
sentences.chinese: 孔子很博學，而他總是通過言傳身教教育他的學生們。

sentences.english: The son HAD well profited by the precept and example of the father.
sentences.chinese: 老太爺的言傳身教早已使他兒子獲益無窮。

sentences.english: There under in my words and deeds toward a better life?
sentences.chinese: 有沒有在我的言傳身教下走向美好的生活呢？

sentences.english: We influence future generations by living for Christ today.
sentences.chinese: 今日竭誠爲主活，言傳身教下一代。

definition: when you teach someone, both teacher and student will benefit
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
(Tw) to guide sb in the right direction/to correct (behavior etc)
use both carrot and stick/use gentle methods and force/an iron hand in a velvet glove
It takes ten years to nurture a tree, but a hundred years to train a man (idiom)/fig. a good education program takes a long time to develop/cf. 十年樹木，百年樹人|十年树木，百年树人
to imbue with/to inculcate/to instill into/to teach/to impart/to channel water to another place
to exhaust one's thoughts and ingenuity (idiom); to think sth through thoroughly/to rack one's brains/to leave no stone unturned
